resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Holes marked into the parchment aligning with each row of text. These holes may be used for binding or text structuring purposes.
resource.chars: Holes marked into the parchment aligning with each row of text. These holes may be used for binding or text structuring purposes.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Repetition of singular characters, in this instance the character ሃ, is often used in Ge'ez to emphasize or reiterate important words. In this case, ሃ respresents a word synoymous to "hallelujah" in English.
resource.chars: Repetition of singular characters, in this instance the character ሃ, is often used in Ge'ez to emphasize or reiterate important words. In this case, ሃ respresents a word synoymous to "hallelujah" in English.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Ge'ez text written in the upper margins of this page. This added text does not appear to be connected to the main body of text, but rather left as a note for the reader (possibly instructional notes for prayers and/or exorcism).
resource.chars: Ge'ez text written in the upper margins of this page. This added text does not appear to be connected to the main body of text, but rather left as a note for the reader (possibly instructional notes for prayers and/or exorcism).
